intro: Maytenus acutangula, commonly known as the sharp-angled maytenus, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Celastraceae and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a serrated margin. The fruit is a small, fleshy berry that contains several seeds.
